pageContent: Background: Metabolic syndrome (MetS) is considered a potential risk factor for adverse outcomes after radical prostatectomy (RP). Furthermore, studies about the effect of MetS on low-risk prostate cancer (PCa) and its implications in active surveillance (AS) are limited.

metaData.source:
Caregiving and social support for gay and bisexual men with prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27530377/
